title: Welcome!
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners understand the structure of the course, including expectations and outputs
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can navigate the platforms that are used to distribute course information

title: Welcome!
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners will be able to articulate the assumptions and histories associated with "field work"
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can create a repository on GitHub

title: Welcome!
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can edit a file on GitHub

title: Waste Research
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners are able to change a non-FINER/PICOT research question into one
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can clone a repository from GitHub into the RStudio Cloud

title: Waste Research
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners are able to create a FINER/PICOT research question
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can render an R Markdown file using the RStudio IDE

title: Waste Research
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners can compare the solid waste management challenges between the minority and majority world
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can commit changes to files in a git repository using the RStudio IDE

title: Waste Research
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners are able to define Main and Sub-research questions
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can push changes to a files tracked in a git repository to GitHub

title: Research Design
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners are able to identify and select the most appropriate research design for the given research question
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners are able to import references to a Zotero group library

title: Research Design
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners are able to articulate the relative pros and cons of cross-sectional, longitudinal, and experimental designs
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can use an exported library from Zotero in Better BibTex Format to generate an automated reference list in an R Markdown file

title: Research Design
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners are able to identify their target population and how it will be reached
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can edit a file in the Citation File Format (.cff) to add their name to the author list

title: Survey Design
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners are able understand the uses and limitations and uses for each type of survey question when it comes to answering (respondent) and analysis (researcher)
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can explain the difference between the markdown (.md) and R Markdown (.Rmd) file format

title: Survey Design
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners can identify variables, units and methods of measurement for survey questions
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can paraphrase how a file written in a markup language like markdown (.md) differs from a file written in a proprietary file format like .docx

title: Survey Design
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners are able to create survey questions using a Likert scale, a continuous outcome, a binary outcome, a categorical outcome
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can identify four components of an R markdown file (YAML, code chunk, R code, markdown)

title: Tools for Data Collection and Data Management
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can use a tool for survey design for 12 to 15 questions using at least two elements of survey logic

title: Tools for Data Collection and Data Management
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can apply 12 principles for data organisation in spreadsheets in the layout of a collected dataset

title: Tools for Data Collection and Data Management
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners understand the importance of documentation and metadata for (research) data management

title: Pre-test and logistics
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners are able to use and trouble-shoot the survey tools of others
learning_objectives_pt2: NA

title: Pre-test and logistics
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners are able to self-organize and prepare time and logistic plans
learning_objectives_pt2: NA

title: Data collection
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners are able to collect data from primary sources (respondents, physical measurements) using the tool they developed
learning_objectives_pt2: NA

title: Data collection
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners understand the time required for data collection (including transport, rejections, etc.)
learning_objectives_pt2: NA

title: Data collection
learning_objectives_pt1: Learners are able to adapt their data collection strategies based on their first experience
learning_objectives_pt2: NA

title: Data Import and Data Types
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can use four functions to import data from four data sources (Google Sheets, MS Excel, local CSV, API CSV)

title: Data Import and Data Types
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can list the four main types of vectors in R

title: Data Import and Data Types
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can use three different ways of getting support in solving coding problems online

title: Exploratory Data Analysis using Data Visualisation
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can describe the four main aesthetic mappings that can be used to visualise data using the ggplot2 R Package

title: Exploratory Data Analysis using Data Visualisation
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can control the colour scaling applied to a plot using colour as an aesthetic mapping

title: Exploratory Data Analysis using Data Visualisation
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can compare three different geoms and their use case

title: Exploratory Data Analysis using Data Visualisation
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can apply a theme to control font types and sizes within a plot

title: Data transformation with dplyr
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can apply ten functions from the dplyr R Package to generate a subset of data for use in a table or plot

title: Data transformation with dplyr
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can apply functions to transform their data from a wide to a long format and vice versa

title: Data transformation with tidyr
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can apply functions from the tidyr R Package to join multiple data sets

title: Data transformation with tidyr
learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can apply functions from the tidyr R Package to transform their data from a wide to a long format and vice versa

learning_objectives_pt2: Learners can use R Markdown and GitHub to publish their group project report
